etymology.description: 亻(亻) (rén, 'person') + phonetic: 阴(陰) (yīn) = combining a person element with the phonetic indicator for sound
etymology.interpretation: 侌(侌) (yīn) combines the person radical, emphasizing human activity or association, with 阴(陰) (yīn) to suggest the phonetic aspect of the character. This formation carries the sound of 'yīn' with a semantic hint of human relevance.

examples.chinese: 在语音学研究中(在語音學研究中)，侌被用作音标(侌被用作音標)。
examples.pinyin: Zài yǔ yīn xué yán jiū zhōng, yīn bèi yòng zuò yīn biāo.
examples.english: In phonetics research, 侌 is used as a phonetic symbol.

examples.chinese: 古代文献中(古代文獻中)，侌常用于注音(侌常用於注音)。
examples.pinyin: Gǔ dài wén xiàn zhōng, yīn cháng yòng yú zhù yīn.
examples.english: In ancient texts, 侌 was commonly used for annotation of pronunciation.
